value.title: Import images in Power BI from local sources
value.excerpt: In todays video I will show you how to import images in Power BI with the help of SQL Jason.  He shows in his blog post how you can import images in Power BI from your local folder for offline use. Read more about it here: http://sqljason.com/2018/01/embedding-images-in-power-bi-using-base64.html  and

value.title: Map locations using Power BI shape maps (Part 1)
value.excerpt: In this video I will show you how to use Power BI visual: Shape maps.  Have you created a country json file? Give it to David!  Link to David's blog post: https://dataveld.wordpress.com/2016/09/12/topojson-map-files-for-power-bi-shape-map/ LInk to David's github library: https://github.com/deldersveld/topojson

value.title: Normalizing data: The what, why and how
value.excerpt: Normalizing data in Power BI: The what, why and how  When analyzing data by population, plotting the row data against the geographical location will fail to reveal important patterns when comparing countries with big differences in population and this is when it is useful to normalize the data. Let me

value.title: Power BI vs Excel: When you should use each tool
value.excerpt: Which tool is best? Power BI or Excel?  Well, it depends on what you are trying to do. Both tools have unique strengths and limitations and in this video I will try to show both.  Hopefully after watching this video, you will have a better understanding of both tools and will know when to use which depending

value.title: Refer to a value, column or row in Power Query
value.excerpt: Have you ever tried to use a specific column, row or value in power query, but didnt now how to do it?  In this video I will show you how to refer to a specific column, row or value using simple commands in power query.   Looking for a download file? value.title: Running totals by subcategory in Power Query!!
value.excerpt: I showed you on last monday's video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uX3_dnb5on0 how to do running totals in power query, and in this video I will show you how to do it but by subcategory or group. value.title: Running totals in power query??? Yes, you can :)
value.excerpt: In today's video, I am going to show you how you can do running totals or cummulative totals in Power Query, but do this only if you have no way to do it using DAX.  Also, I will show you how List.Range work, really cool function :)  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: Debugging a slow Power BI report with Phil Seamark

value.title: Deployment Pipelines give you more CONTROL (Power BI Premium)
value.excerpt: With Deployment Pipelines, you can control your application life cycle stages. Keep content in sync at the different stages of your development. Power BI Premium is required.  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/create-reports/deployment-pipelines-overview https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/create-reports/deployment-pipelines-process

value.title: Dynamic labels in Power BI using DAX
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick uses a little DAX, and the SelectedValue function, to get you some dynamic labels in your Power BI reports.  For more information about SelectedValue, check out Marco Russo's blog on the function - https://www.sqlbi.com/articles/using-the-selectedvalue-function-in-dax/  LET'S CONNECT!

value.title: Expand lists in Power BI (also a look at M Syntax)

value.title: Incremental Refresh with Power BI Premium
value.excerpt: In this video, Christian Wade joined Adam Saxton to discuss Incremental Refresh with Power BI Premium. You can use Incremental Refresh with Power BI Premium to take your dataset beyond 1GB and avoid failures such as timeouts.  Incremental Refresh with Power BI Premium documentation - https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/service-premium-incremental-refresh

value.title: Start your Power BI journey with Guy in a Cube
